subject: Economics
subcategory: Economic Crises That Shook the World
title: The Panic of 1907: The Crisis That Created the Fed
description: A 60-second lesson on The Panic of 1907: The Crisis That Created the Fed.

hook.text: In 1907, one man personally stopped a financial panic. J.P.

buildup.text: A failed attempt to corner the copper market triggered bank runs across New York. The stock market dropped 50%.

discovery.text: There was no central bank. Morgan assembled private bankers and forced them to pool money and save the banking system.

twist.text: Congress realized a 70-year-old private citizen shouldn't be the last line of defense.

climax.text: The 1907 panic proved that modern economies need a lender of last resort.

punchline.text: The Federal Reserve exists because one old banker couldn't live forever.

quiz.question: How did the 1907 panic lead to the Federal Reserve?
options: Relying on one private citizen (J.P. Morgan) to stop panics proved unsustainable
